newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada June retail sales rise 0.6 pct from May.
newsitem.headline: Canada June retail sales rise 0.6 pct from May.

text.p: Canadian retail sales rose 0.6 percent in June to a seasonally adjusted C$17.97 billion from C$17.86 billion in May (revised from C$17.80 billion) Statistics Canada said on Thursday.
Sales, ex vehicles, s/a +0.3 +0.9 C$13.67 bln
A Reuter survey of economists had forecast that seasonally adjusted retail sales would rise by 0.3 percent in June.
It said early indications for July pointed to a drop.
Statistics Canada said sales rose over the month in five of the seven major groups, accounting for almost 71.0 percent of total retail trade.
Statistics Canada said retail sales rose 2.3 percent in the first half of 1996 from the same period in 1995.
(For more information from Statistics Canada, contact the Retail Trade Section, Industry Division, Pierre Desjardins at 613-951-9682).
